metadata.Title: CVE-2023-24329 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description: An issue in the urllib.parse component of Python before 3.11.4 allows attackers to bypass blocklisting methods by supplying a URL that starts with blank characters.

notes.Note: leosilva> there are some discussions around that issue that raises doubts about if it was properly fixed or not. till further investigation it'll be marked as needed again.

criterions.comment: python2.7: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
python3.5: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
